data.title: Jan Troell in Person
data.meta_description: Perhaps best known for his 1971 film The Emigrants, which was nominated for five Academy Awards, Swedish director, writer, and cinematographer Jan Troell is “among the world's most distinguished filmmakers” (Mike Hale, New York Times). Troell joins us to present his most recent work, Everlasting Moments.
data.text:
Perhaps best known for his 1971 film The Emigrants, which was nominated for five Academy Awards, Swedish director, writer, and cinematographer Jan Troell is “among the world's most distinguished filmmakers” (Mike Hale, New York Times). Troell joins us to present his most recent work, Everlasting Moments.

Perhaps best known for his 1971 film The Emigrants, which was nominated for five Academy Awards, Swedish director, writer, and cinematographer Jan Troell is “among the world's most distinguished filmmakers” (Mike Hale, New York Times). Troell joins us to present his most recent work, Everlasting Moments.
